initialnote: Minister of Tourism, Hon Edmund Bartlett and Health and Wellness Minister, Hon Christopher Tufton announce the June 15 full reopening of Jamaicaâs borders to international travel.  http://archive.fo/5z5mQ      They were required to undergo health screening and risk assessment, including temperature checks and an interview by a health officer.  http://archive.vn/JOFVU      Access to island is limited to a contained corridor for visitors:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200620131132/https://jis.gov.jm/covid-19-resilient-corridor-established-for-tourists/

The total lockdown will be lifted with effect from Sunday, June 21, starting at 5:00 AMCompanies and organizations can again maintain their normal opening hours; taking into account the social distances, wash hands and wear mouth and nose cover. Of course, taking into account that everyone is home at 8 p.m. The following sectors will remain closed to the public, namely: hotels, casinos, places of worship, covered vegetable, fruit, meat and fish markets, brothels and barsIndoor gyms remain closed.  Linkhttps://web.archive.org/web/20200624114229/https://covid-19.sr/president-bouterse-kondigt-versoepeling-en-zestal-maatregelen-aan/

. According to address of President on 20th June "Domestic flights of persons and goods are allowed under strict guidelines". This shows internal movement is allowed.
